posts._title: Werner Schroeter – Die Generalprobe AKA Dress Rehearsal (1980)
posts.title: Die Generalprobe
posts.excerpt: The first of Schroeter’s series of documentaries about theatrical performers, Dress Rehearsal began as a commission by German television for a short report on the 1980 edition of the World Theatre Festival in Nancy, France. Inspired by a number of the performers at the festival, Schroeter created instead a feature-length film essay. In particular, he …

posts.title: The Falconer
posts.excerpt: Fictional documentary goes on the trail of sixties cultural renegade Peter Whitehead, underground filmmaker, writer, occultist and sometime falconer.

posts._title: Jean Renoir – Le Tournoi dans la cité AKA The Tournament (1928)
posts.title: Le Tournoi dans la cité
posts.excerpt: IMDb:This isn’t really a Jean Renoir-originated film. It was commissioned by a historical society to commemorate 500 years of history in whichever French city it was that this was made. Portions of the film are apparently lost, and what I saw was a three-reel reconstruction made much later, probably by the BBC. It runs about …

posts._title: Guru Dutt – Aar-Paar aka Across the Heart (1954)
posts.title: Aar-Paar
posts.excerpt: Kalu (Guru Dutt), a taxi driver who was sentenced to prison for speeding, is released two months before his term for good behaviour. His old employer refuses to let him drive his taxi again. Wandering the streets, Kalu helps a young woman Nikki (Shyama) to fix her car. Kalu goes home but his brother-in-law will …

posts.title: Hank and Mike
posts.excerpt: Two blue-collar Easter Bunnies get fired and try their hand at an assortment of odd jobs, failing at each. Fighting depression, debt and eventually each other, their lives start to unravel until they realize that without their job they are nothing.

posts.title: Films D’Amour (1968 – 1989)
posts.excerpt: Re-Voir VHS transfer includes several found-footage movies from the famed lettrist: L’Amour réinventé, 1979, 15 min.Des scènes d’amour très réalistes avec force détails et gros plans, 1978, 15 min 30.L’Amour, qu’est-ce ?, 1976-1989, 24 min.Chantal D., Star, 1968, 26 min.

posts._title: Maurice Lemaître – Nos Stars / Le petit dieu (2002)
posts.title: Nos Stars / Le petit dieu
posts.excerpt: OUR STARS & THE LITTLE GOD Maurice Lemaître is amongst one of the most important and creative artists of the second half of the 20th century. His cinematic work has led to a fundamental questioning of the relationship between film and spectator, image and sound, art and criticism, cinema and other types of images. His …

posts._title: Erden Kiral – Ayna AKA Der Spiegel AKA The Mirror (1984)
posts.title: Ayna
posts.excerpt: Quote:Der Spiegel reflects the sad existence of a village couple, Necmetting and Zelihan, whose lives are regulated by nature and the all-powerful feudal lord. When the lord’s good-looking brother tries to seduce beautiful Zelihan, her husband has no choice but take up arms to restore his lost honor.

posts._title: Nikolaj Arcel – En kongelig affære aka A Royal Affair (2012)
posts.title: En kongelig affære
posts.excerpt: A young queen, who is married to an insane king, falls secretly in love with her physician –and together they start a revolution that changes a nation forever.

posts._title: Phil Karlson – Ladies of the Chorus (1949)
posts.title: Ladies of the Chorus
posts.excerpt: Andrea Passafiume wrote:Ladies of the ChorusMarilyn Monroe makes an early big screen appearance in director Phil Karlson’s 1949 entertaining B musical Ladies of the Chorus. In her first starring role, Monroe plays Peggy Martin, a young chorus girl in a burlesque show who works alongside her mother, Mae (Adele Jergens). When Peggy is pursued by …
